org.jppf.node.protocol

Class MemoryLocation

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jppf.node.protocol.AbstractLocation<byte[]>
      • org.jppf.node.protocol.MemoryLocation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Location<byte[]>

    public class MemoryLocation
extends AbstractLocation<byte[]>
    Wrapper fro manipulating a block of data in memory. This implementation of the Location interface allows writing to and reading from a byte array.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.jppf.node.protocol.AbstractLocation

        eventsEnabled, listeners, path

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Initialize this location with the specified buffer.

      Initialize this location with the specified byte array.
      MemoryLocation(int size)
      Initialize this location and create a buffer of the specified size.

        Initialize this location and create a buffer of the specified size.

              int offset,
              int len)
        Initialize this location with the specified byte array.
        Parameters:
        buffer - an array of bytes.
        offset - the start position in the array of bytes.
        len - the length of the buffer.

      • size

        public long size()
        Get the size of the file this location points to.
        Returns:
        the size as a long value, or -1 if the file does not exist.

      • toByteArray

        public byte[] toByteArray()
        Get the content at this location as an array of bytes. This method is overridden from AbstractLocation.toByteArray() for improved performance.
        Specified by:
        toByteArray in interface Location<byte[]>
        Overrides:
        toByteArray in class AbstractLocation<byte[]>
        Returns:
        a byte array with a length equals to this location's size and starting at the offset specified in the constructor, if any.
